{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3352611,"name":"Eric G","username":"ericg2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/3ec8ea/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-04T22:08:46.642Z","cooked":"

Hello Everyone,

During auto testing, I experienced some problems with PID tuning. I ended up fixing the issue but I thought of one question: Is there any way to configure the AutoBuilder PID on-the-fly (as in not re-deploying)? I know PathPlanner allows me to adjust the paths without redeploying, so can PID be setup the same way?

I already have a way to tune other PID and Speed values on the Dashboard without re-deploying. Is anything like this possible?

Thanks,
Eric

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2024-04-04T22:08:46.642Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":35,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":201.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461327,"topic_slug":"tuning-pathplanner-pid-on-the-fly","display_username":"Eric G","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53588,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/tuning-pathplanner-pid-on-the-fly/461327/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3356060,"name":"Carlos Salazar","username":"StarbuckBarista","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starbuckbarista/{size}/186251_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T07:33:06.465Z","cooked":"

The simple answer is no; there isn’t any built-in way to quickly change these values, but there isn’t really a need to since redeploying isn’t that taxing. These values shouldn’t need to be changed often anyway.

If you really wanted to, you could utilize SmartDashboard.getNumber() within AutoBuilder.configureHolonomic(). Note that you would have to call this configuration method again to change the values (the most straightforward way I can see is on enable) and PathPlanner would complain to the console every time you reconfigured.
